verses.kjv: For Zion’s sake will I not hold my peace, and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, until the righteousness thereof go forth as brightness, and the salvation thereof as a lamp that burneth.
verses.web: For Zion’s sake I will not hold my peace, and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, until her righteousness shines out like the dawn, and her salvation like a burning lamp.
verses.ct: For Zion's sake I will not stay silent, and for Jerusalem's sake I will not stop — not until her righteousness blazes like the dawn and her salvation burns like a shining torch.

verses.kjv: And the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness, and all kings thy glory: and thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of the LORD shall name.
verses.web: The nations will see your righteousness, and all kings your glory. You will be called by a new name, which LORD’s mouth will name.
verses.ct: The nations will see your righteousness, and every king will witness your glory. You will be given a new name — one that the LORD himself will speak over you.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the LORD, and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.
verses.web: You will also be a crown of beauty in LORD‘s hand, and a royal diadem in your God’s hand.
verses.ct: You will be a crown of glory in the LORD's hand, a royal diadem held up by your God.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt no more be termed Forsaken; neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate: but thou shalt be called Hephzibah, and thy land Beulah: for the LORD delighteth in thee, and thy land shall be married.
verses.web: You will not be called Forsaken any more, nor will your land be called Desolate any more; but you will be called Hephzibah, and your land Beulah; for LORD delights in you, and your land will be married.
verses.ct: No one will call you "Forsaken" anymore, and your land will never again be called "Desolate." Instead, you will be called Hephzibah — meaning "My Delight Is in Her" — and your land will be called Beulah — meaning "Married" — because the LORD delights in you, and your land will be like a bride claimed by her husband.

verses.kjv: For as a young man marrieth a virgin, so shall thy sons marry thee: and as the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride, so shall thy God rejoice over thee.
verses.web: For as a young man marries a virgin, so your sons will marry you. As a bridegroom rejoices over his bride, so your God will rejoice over you.
verses.ct: Just as a young man marries a young woman, so your people will be united with you. And just as a bridegroom celebrates over his bride, so your God will celebrate over you.

verses.kjv: I have set watchmen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, which shall never hold their peace day nor night: ye that make mention of the LORD, keep not silence,
verses.web: I have set watchmen on your walls, Jerusalem. They will never be silent day nor night. You who call on LORD, take no rest,
verses.ct: Jerusalem, I have posted watchmen on your walls who will never be silent, day or night. You who call on the LORD, don't stop —

verses.kjv: And give him no rest, till he establish, and till he make Jerusalem a praise in the earth.
verses.web: and give him no rest, until he establishes, and until he makes Jerusalem a praise in the earth.
verses.ct: and give him no rest until he establishes Jerusalem and makes it a place the whole earth praises.

verses.kjv: The LORD hath sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Surely I will no more give thy corn to be meat for thine enemies; and the sons of the stranger shall not drink thy wine, for the which thou hast laboured:
verses.web: LORD has sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, “Surely I will no more give your grain to be food for your enemies, and foreigners will not drink your new wine, for which you have labored,
verses.ct: The LORD has sworn an oath by his own mighty hand and powerful arm: "Never again will I let your enemies eat the grain you harvested. Never again will foreigners drink the wine you worked so hard to produce.

verses.kjv: But they that have gathered it shall eat it, and praise the LORD; and they that have brought it together shall drink it in the courts of my holiness.
verses.web: but those who have harvested it will eat it, and praise LORD. Those who have gathered it will drink it in the courts of my sanctuary.”
verses.ct: Instead, those who harvest the grain will eat it and praise the LORD, and those who gather the grapes will drink the wine in the courts of my sanctuary."

verses.kjv: Go through, go through the gates; prepare ye the way of the people; cast up, cast up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a standard for the people.
verses.web: Go through, go through the gates! Prepare the way of the people! Build up, build up the highway! Gather out the stones! Lift up a banner for the peoples.
verses.ct: Go through the gates! Go through them! Clear the road for the people! Build up the highway — build it high! Remove every stone from the path! Raise a banner for the nations to see!

verses.kjv: Behold, the LORD hath proclaimed unto the end of the world, Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy salvation cometh; behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.
verses.web: Behold, LORD has proclaimed to the end of the earth, “Say to the daughter of Zion, ‘Behold, your salvation comes! Behold, his reward is with him, and his recompense before him!’ ”
verses.ct: Listen — the LORD has sent this announcement to the ends of the earth: "Tell the people of Zion, 'Look! Your salvation is coming! He brings his reward with him, and those he has rescued go before him.'"

verses.kjv: And they shall call them, The holy people, The redeemed of the LORD: and thou shalt be called, Sought out, A city not forsaken.
verses.web: They will call them “The Holy People, LORD’s Redeemed”. You will be called “Sought Out, A City Not Forsaken”.
verses.ct: They will be called "The Holy People, the Redeemed of the LORD." And you, Jerusalem, will be known as "Sought After, A City No Longer Forsaken."
